page.title: 14St.James'Church,Ocle Pychard
page.content: This church consists of a nave, a chancel, a small recess and a tower with four bells. The church has a service every Sunday, which is fairly unusual for such a small community. The services are taken by a retired member of the clergy who looks after two parishes. Christenings, funerals and weddings take place quite regularly. Burials in the churchyard are now allowed only if the deceased has some connection with the parish, to prevent overcrowding as space has now become limited.
